summary: A mod which adds Pauldrons and Greaves to the game
descriptionHtml:
Remember when in Morrowind you could have differing pauldrons? And how shocked you were when you discovered greaves were not in Skyrim? Well grief no longer! This mod aims to bring it all back! No longer will you be forced to wear one piece suits! No longer will you be forced to download tons of armour mods just to get some variation! No longer will your character look so stale and plain! Because now, you can truly design your character and feel awesome with your own customized set of armour!

Overview:

Adds new greaves, cuirasses and pauldrons.

Vanilla chest armour will take up greaves, cuirass and both pauldron slots.
Robes and clothes will only use up cuirass slots. (Dat Battlemage look!)
Pauldrons can differ and be worn without a cuirass. (Dat Gladiator look!)

They are both craftable and temperable.
Both unenchanted and enchanted versions can be found.

Additional Features:
There are sliders to adjust the weight of the armour in the SkyProc patcher.
There are sliders to adjust the tempering and armour rating of armour in an MCM menu.

Optional, but required for the MCM menue:
SKSE 1.6.13 or higher
SkyUI 3.4 or higher



Help finish the project:
The cuirass meshes came from Topvman so they still have pauldrons attached to them (however, you can place other pauldrons on top of them). If a modeler could so kindly remove them it would be very appreciated.
Any help will be appropriately credited of course.

If you plan on wearing a cuirass without any type of greaves, your legs will disappear unless you add the "wearable legs" item through console commands and equip it.
So if someone could also fix that, it would also be appreciated and credited.
author: Mopel
